png

Class PngChunkTIME

  • java.lang.Object
    • png.PngChunk
      • png.PngChunkTIME

  • public class PngChunkTIME
extends PngChunk
    Encapsulates the tIME ancillary chunk, which records the last modification time of the image content (not the creation time).

    According to the PNG specification, the time values must represent Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) to ensure consistency across different time zones.

    Chunk Layout (7 bytes):

    • Year: 2 bytes (complete year, e.g., 2026)
    • Month: 1 byte (1-12)
    • Day: 1 byte (1-31)
    • Hour: 1 byte (0-23)
    • Minute: 1 byte (0-59)
    • Second: 1 byte (0-60; 60 allows for leap seconds)

    • Method Detail

      • getModificationDate

        public java.util.Date getModificationDate()
        Converts the binary fields into a Java Date object.

        Note: PNG tIME is defined as UTC. This method compensates for Java's 0-based Calendar months (where January is 0) by subtracting 1 from the raw month value.

        Returns:
        a Date representing the image modification time in UTC

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from class: PngChunk
        Returns a string representation of the chunk's properties and contents. If the chunk only has binary data and it is non-textual, it will indicate the size for context only.
        Overrides:
        toString in class PngChunk
        Returns:
        a formatted string describing this chunk
